Multiselect

Use multiselect to allow the user to search or browse a list of predefined options, and select some or all applicable options.

Installation 

                  
                    npm i @govflanders/vl-ui-multiselect

or 

                  
                    yarn add @govflanders/vl-ui-multiselect

Usage

Import JS

                  
                  import { Multiselect } from '@govflanders/vl-ui-multiselect';

Info and options

[data-multiselect]: Add this attribute to initialize the multiselect component. Make sure to provide the correct markup. Take a look at the code example. [data-search-empty="Geen resultaten gevonden"]: Updates the response message when no results are found in the list. [data-id]: Provide this attribute on the <select> element to link the default and generated <select> elements. In case no data-id is provided, an id is generated. <optgroup>: Optgroup is supported. Use this attribute in the default multiselect implementation. <option placeholder>: Add this element to set a placeholder when no options are selected.

Multiselect

Use a multiselect field to allow the user to choose from predefined options in a list. In the editable search field, type a search term and/or filter the options in a long(er) list. Remove keywords from the multiselect bar by clicking the x on the keyword.

      
  <label class="vl-form__label"
    for=""
  >
    
  </label>
  <div class="vl-form__input">
    <div class="js-vl-multiselect">
      <select id=""
        multiple
        name="multiselect"
        class="vl-multiselect"
        data-vl-multiselect>
        <optgroup label="Landen"><optionselectedvalue="België">België</option><optionvalue="Duitsland">Duitsland</option><optionvalue="Frankrijk">Frankrijk</option></optgroup><optgroup label="Steden"><optionselectedvalue="Brugge">Brugge</option><optionvalue="Brussel">Brussel</option><optionvalue="Gent">Gent</option></optgroup>
      </select>
    </div>
  </div>

Accessibility

Due to its complexity, this component cannot be made accessible. Whenever possible, use standard checkboxes instead because they are fully accessible and more user friendly than a multiselect component.
